content: Well, let me start by doing a sweep of the items
Prelude collision lint: invalid suggestion for T::from_iter when T is generic.
Got a volunteer, but no PR yet that I know of
(as I said before, I won't be able to participate in this check-in for the next hour, but I suppose I can come back later and add my updates)
(that's what I figured, I'd get the "rote part" done)

nikomatsakis said:

Got a volunteer, but no PR yet that I know of

they also didn't respond to my ping; we may want to take this over at some point, not sure.
For now I'll leave another comment!
i don't think we need to block the crater run on it. there's probably not much code that would run into this problem
That's what I was wondering, just how urgent is this
The question to my mind is more whether it blocks us from starting the "public test" announcement
probably not
yeah
In that case, we can let it slide a bit.
we should move columns though
I moved it to "stable blockers"

OK

Documentation
We have 3 open PRs on the edition-guide
Looks like rust-lang/edition-guide#255 is ready to merge, but I'm going to give it a quick skim
This looks really great, @Eric Huss
(sorry, got distracted)
looks like the other bugs are largely assigned to @rylev
exceptions:

prefix syntax

has PR edition-guide#249 by @Josh Triplett, @rylev asked whether assistance is needed

cargo resolver changes edition-guide#239

Assigned to @Eric Huss
prepare PR that will "dry run" the crater migration #85895
@Eric Huss prepared a hacked cargo that should work :tada:
Discussed in #edition 2021 > crater run , I think
OK, that's everything apart from stabilization
Looking solid

nikomatsakis said:

looks like the other bugs are largely assigned to rylev

I should have the docs done by today.
@nikomatsakis does this mean we're good for the blog post to go live tomorrow?
The only question was your desire to revisit stable blockers and assess how realistic the September stabilization date is
Ok I'll start a new thread for looking through stablization
Or I guess we can just do it here.

Tracking Issue for edition-dependent IntoIterator for arrays (#84513)
We have an outstanding todo to break this issue up into smaller issues to make tracking easier
A quick scan - it looks like nothing big is left to do (mostly docs and some lint improvements).

prepare PR that will "dry run" the crater migration (#85895)
Since the crater run is good to go and it's hard to predict how much fall out will come from it, I don't think we should push back stabilization due to it.
We have all of August to address issues we find from it which seems reasonable.

Prelude collision lint: invalid suggestion for T::from_iter when T is generic. (#86940)
Should hopefully be fixed this week (we should reassign by Wednesday if no PR has been created by then)

document and test the precise span that triggers edition-dependent behavior #86539
@nikomatsakis this seems pretty straight-forward but a bit open ended. Any concern about getting this done before September?
Even more importantly, who can do that work? No one is currently assigned

Tracking Issue for RFC 3101: Reserved Prefixes #84978
Similar story here. The work is pretty straight-forward - we just need someone to take it over the finish line. I believe @scottmcm was working on this before. Perhaps they can do the stabilization work?

Stabilize "force warn" option #86516
This should be straight-forward, and I have no doubt I'll be able to finish this in the coming weeks.

Write specification for Capture Analysis #53
@nikomatsakis what's the estimate for this work item? It seems like it should also be doable before september, no?
That's everything we have tracked so far. @Mara @nikomatsakis Anything strike you as missing?
There's some cleanup we need to do in the edition guide to switch the narrative from 2018 to 2021. There doesn't seem to be an issue for this. I can create one.
Re: the blog: We then need someone to work with the team on merging the blog post tomorrow (and getting the Rust Twitter handle to tweet about it)

rylev said:

Write specification for Capture Analysis #53
nikomatsakis what's the estimate for this work item? It seems like it should also be doable before september, no?

Yes, we've basically done this already.

rylev said:

Re: the blog: We then need someone to work with the team on merging the blog post tomorrow (and getting the Rust Twitter handle to tweet about it)

Perhaps @simulacrum can manage that?

rylev said:

document and test the precise span that triggers edition-dependent behavior #86539
nikomatsakis this seems pretty straight-forward but a bit open ended. Any concern about getting this done before September?

Hmm. Not especially, but we do need to decide who will do it.
Looks like @Mara did a bunch of research here
I'll have to read through that in detail
I can take a look at the blog
Not sure if this is the one I had reviewed before
Hm it looks ok I think
I've asked in core and a ping tomorrow morning would be great
@nikomatsakis quick update: now that I'm done with the presentation for CTCFT, I'll work on reserved prefix edition guide material shortly.
